Description: Painted calcite shabti of Tamery (?) with a short blue lappet-wig, green, black and orange facial features, crudely represented crossed arms in black paint holding one(surviving) painted hoe, the front of the legs is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs, the back has crude representation of a red seed-bag, the figure bears traces of green glaze.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
